Question: When driving into bright sunlight, you should use sunglasses and your vehicle sun visors for safety. What else are you advised to do?

Answers.Answer: Turn the headlights of your vehicle on
Drive safely on the far left of the road
Look at and drive close to the centre of the road
Pull over or stop and wait for a few minutes

Question: What does it mean if yellow traffic signals are flashing?

Answers.Answer: That a crash has just happened
The traffic signals are not working, apply the give way rules
Vehicles may only proceed straight ahead and not turn
Emergency vehicles are about to come through

Question: Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?

Answers.Answer: The child’s parents
The driver of the vehicle
The owner of the vehicle
The child

Question: At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back
have its hazard lights on
be sounding its horn
be travelling slower than 50km/h

Question: The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: What does a white diamond painted on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: A pedestrian crossing ahead
Traffic signals ahead
A roundabout ahead
An intersection ahead

Question: You are coming up to a school patrol crossing and both signs are held out. When can you drive on?

Answers.Answer: When both signs have been pulled in
When there are no pedestrians on the crossing
When the sign on your side of the crossing has been pulled in
When there are no pedestrians on your half of the crossing

Question: What should you do if the vehicle behind you starts to pass you?

Answers.Answer: Move over to the right so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Signal for them to stay behind you because you think they are going too fast
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe and do not speed up

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving as the cyclist has to stop
Stop and give way to the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: Which person can legally stop and do a roadside check of your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: A police officer
An AA mechanic
A tow truck driver
An ambulance driver

Question: You look in the mirror and see a cyclist – what should you do when opening the car door?

Answers.Answer: Open the door and expect the cyclist to stop
Open the door and expect the cyclist to swerve
Wait for the cyclist to go past before opening the door
Warn the cyclist by sounding the horn before opening the door

Question: When should you apply the 4-second rule?

Answers.Answer: Never. You should only use the 2-second rule
In wet, frosty or icy road conditions
When passing other vehicles
When waiting for any vehicles coming over a one-way bridge

Question: If you have a restricted licence you can carry a passenger if they are your spouse.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: Who can require you to undergo a breath screening test?

Answers.Answer: An ambulance officer
A doctor
A member of the public
A police officer

Question: What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: What must you do when red lights are flashing at a railway level crossing?

Answers.Answer: Drive over the lines as soon as the train has passed
Slow down and then drive over the lines
Stop until the lights stop flashing
Stop and if no train is coming you may drive over the lines

Question: You have a restricted licence. A condition for driving at night without a supervisor is that you MUST NOT drive between:

Answers.Answer: 8pm to 6am
10pm to 5am
10pm to 6am
11am and 7am

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: When traffic is merging, what is a good rule to follow?

Answers.Answer: Slow down to 40km/h
Speed up to make room behind
Let one vehicle in and then go
Let two vehicles in and then go

Question: When must you turn your vehicle headlights on?

Answers.Answer: 15 minutes after sunset until 15 minutes before sunrise
30 minutes after sunset until 30 minutes before sunrise
45 minutes after sunset until 45 minutes before sunrise
1 hour after sunset until 1 hour before sunrise

Question: What is the recommended distance you should allow when driving past a cyclist?

Answers.Answer: 0.5 metres
1.0 metres
1.5 metres
2.0 metres

Question: What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Drive up onto the footpath
Pull over and allow it to pass
Keep driving as you were

Question: What must you do when you see 2 red lights flashing outside a fire station?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and drive on carefully if the way is clear
Slow down and stop if any other vehicle is coming
Slow down to 20km/h
Stop until the lights stop flashing

Question: You are driving on a road with marked lanes and you are in the lane with an arrow showing a left turn only. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive straight ahead
Turn left
Turn right
Not signal

Question: If anybody is hurt in a crash, the driver must tell a police officer as soon as possible but within:

Answers.Answer: 24 hours
36 hours
48 hours
60 hours

Question: The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top centre of the windscreen
left of the windscreen
top right corner of the windscreen

Question: What must you do at an intersection controlled by a give way sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
You must not go unless it is safe
Give way to all other vehicles, except those that have stopped at a stop sign
All of the above

Question: If you have to drive at a slow speed which may hold up other vehicles, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep as close as you can to the centre of the road
Keep as close as you can to the left side of the road
Make the traffic behind you slow down to the speed that you are driving at
Drive down the middle of the road so that any vehicles behind you can pass on the left

Question: What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Brake suddenly to warn them
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass
